Rows are sorted by transcriptIndex field to maintain consistent ordering. Query includes referenceAllele and alternateAllele fields used in Description component. The in-silico prediction fields (lofteePrediction, siftPrediction, polyphenPrediction) are returned but appear to be null in test data - may be populated for other variants. This implements Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) annotations showing how variants affect genes and transcripts.

description: Retrieves in silico variant effect predictions from multiple computational methods (CADD, PolyPhen, SIFT, etc.) including assessment scores, normalized scores, and prediction flags for a specific genetic variant.
keywords: variant, effect, prediction, in silico, CADD, PolyPhen, SIFT, assessment, score, pathogenicity, VEP, GERP, AlphaMissense, FoldX, computational-prediction, variant-annotation
notes: Query successfully tested with variants 19_44908822_C_T (rs7412, APOE variant) and 1_113761186_C_A. No pagination - returns all variant effect predictions in a single response array. Response includes variant object with id (variant identifier in chr_pos_ref_alt format), referenceAllele, alternateAllele, and variantEffect array where each entry contains: method (prediction tool name like VEP, SIFT, GERP, AlphaMissense, FoldX), assessment (categorical prediction like missense_variant, deleterious, ambiguous, or null for numeric-only tools), score (raw prediction score from the tool, range varies by method), assessmentFlag (optional warning/flag about prediction quality or context, or null), normalisedScore (score normalized to 0-1 scale for cross-method comparison). For rs7412: returned 5 predictions from VEP (score=0.66, assessment=missense_variant), SIFT (score=0, assessment=deleterious, normalisedScore=1 indicating high deleteriousness), GERP (score=4.61, normalisedScore=0.913 indicating high conservation), AlphaMissense (score=0.422, assessment=ambiguous, normalisedScore=0.005), and FoldX (score=0.91, normalisedScore=0.455 indicating moderate structural impact). For 1_113761186_C_A: returned 2 predictions from VEP (score=0, assessment=upstream_gene_variant, normalisedScore=0 indicating no coding impact) and GERP (score=-5.43, normalisedScore=0 indicating low conservation). No fragments to inline. Used in VariantEffect section Body.tsx component which displays both table and chart views. Table view uses OtTable with sortable columns: Method (with tooltip showing method description and documentation link from VARIANT_EFFECT_METHODS constant), Prediction (assessment value with tooltip if assessmentFlag present), Score (raw score to 3 sig figs), and Normalised score (normalized score to 3 decimals). Chart view uses VariantEffectPlot component showing normalized scores across methods. Data is filtered to remove null methods and sorted alphabetically by method prettyName. The component sets defaultView=VIEW.chart to display visualization first. Section visibility determined by hasData function checking variantEffect.length > 0. Prediction methods include: VEP (Variant Effect Predictor, reports consequence types), SIFT (sorting intolerant from tolerant, predicts protein function impact), GERP (genomic evolutionary rate profiling, conservation score), AlphaMissense (DeepMind deep learning pathogenicity predictor), and FoldX (protein stability and folding impact prediction). Related constants in @ot/constants define VARIANT_EFFECT_METHODS with prettyName, description, and docsUrl for each method. The normalisedScore field enables fair comparison across methods despite different raw score ranges (e.g., SIFT 0-1, GERP -12 to +6, VEP 0-1 for missense tolerance). Section id is in_silico_predictors with name Variant effect and shortName VP.
